* = Graded assignment

Tentative lecture topics (aim for 18-20 lectures)

  1. Introduction to statistics

    • goals of statistics (exploration, inference, prediction)
    • populations vs samples
    • uncertainty

  2. Linear regression

    • model structure: linear predictor + error
    • parameter interpretation
    • assumptions

  3. Inference

    • sampling distribution
    • standard error
    • confidence intervals

  4. Categorical predictor

    • matrix notation
    • dummy variables
    • formulated as t-test

  5. Null hypothesis testing

    • p-values
    • power (intuition)

  6. Categorical predictor > 2 levels

    • linear model
    • formulated as ANOVA

  7. Multiple comparisons

    • contrasts/pre-planned hypotheses

  8. Causal inference

  9. Multiple regression

    • continuous + categorical

    • 1 continuous

    • categorical

    • link to blocking/ANCOVA

  10. Interactions

  • link to factorial design

  1. Goodness-of-fit/diagnostics (maybe move earlier)

  2. Model selection

  3. Random effects/mixed models

  4. Nested/split-plot

  5. Repeated measures

  6. GLM: Logistic regression

  7. GLM: Poisson regression

  8. GLM: Zero-inflated data
